35232142: Severe flooding in Scotland has caused extensive damage to homes and businesses, prompting calls for more preventative measures and faster flood protection plans.
40143035: Two tour buses were set on fire at a hotel in Northern Ireland, forcing guests to evacuate and causing damage to personal belongings.
35951548: Mercedes outpaced Ferrari in Bahrain Grand Prix qualifying, with Lewis Hamilton securing pole position and Sebastian Vettel starting third.
36266422: John Edward Bates faces 22 charges, including indecency with a child, denying all allegations of sexual abuse made by four male complainants during his time as a scout leader.
38826984: Patients and staff were evacuated from Cerahpasa hospital after a man receiving treatment threatened to shoot himself and others, but earlier reports of hostages were incorrect.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors defeated the Dragons in a rugby match with a last-minute try, showcasing their superior depth and bench experience.
20836172: Veronica Vanessa Chango-Alverez, 31, was killed in a hit-and-run in Streatham, London, and police are seeking Nathan Davis in connection with the incident.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Demoitie died in a collision with a motorbike during a race, sparking concerns about safety and prompting calls for improved regulations.
40758845: Manchester City's Ilkay Gundogan is optimistic about his recovery from injury and eager to return to the field, expressing confidence in his team's prospects for the upcoming season.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to the hospital after a crash at the A127 junction in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex, leading to a police investigation.
34615665: Hurricane Patricia is the strongest tropical storm to hit mainland Mexico since 1959, prompting questions about how storm categories are determined.
35890902: Security firm Bastille Networks discovered vulnerabilities in wireless mice that could allow attackers to spoof signals and take control of computers, affecting mice from HP, Lenovo, Amazon, and Dell.
37922330: 38 staff at Galashiels-based Murray and Burrell face redundancies due to adverse trading conditions, but there is hope for some to find jobs at a nearby building firm.
30844962: The European Commission has doubts about Luxembourg's tax arrangement with Amazon, suspecting it may constitute state aid and violate EU rules.
36217333: The Balmoral Show, a three-day agricultural event in Northern Ireland, features local produce, livestock showcases, and family fun activities.
30816523: Max Mosley is suing Google to block photos of him at a sex party, arguing that he no longer has a reasonable expectation of privacy.
38900884: Bath-born player Eddie Jackson's injury is a big blow for Dragons, but it presents an opportunity for other players to step up.
13890581: The Cornish Language Partnership receives three-year funding to ensure the survival of the language, with a warning that long-term support should come from Cornwall.
40194700: Monaco's coach, Leonardo Jardim, has decided to stay with the club despite receiving offers from elsewhere, demonstrating the team's ambition.
37903647: The State Department criticized Nicaragua's election as flawed and not free, as President Ortega won with limited opposition and international monitoring.
13291223: South African authorities have announced a task team to address the issue of "corrective rape" against lesbians following international pressure.
36052570: Big oil producing nations meet in Qatar to discuss production freeze, but doubts remain about its impact on oversupply; US stocks fall, Citigroup sets cash aside for energy industry losses.
34944735: A study by US biologists found that the vibrant blue color in tarantulas evolved independently at least eight times, suggesting an important visual signaling function.
32159602: Andreas Lubitz's internet searches revealed interest in suicide methods and cockpit door security, supporting the theory that he intentionally crashed Germanwings Flight 9525.
34988915: Former radio DJ Mr. Fox denies multiple counts of indecent and sexual assault, claiming his behavior was consensual and part of the workplace culture.
37889203: Tottenham's Mauricio Pochettino confirmed that midfielder Dele Alli will be sidelined for "a few weeks" due to a knee injury sustained in training.
33609927: Jehovah's Witnesses' explicit policy of dealing with abuse in-house and reluctance to co-operate with authorities has led to delayed justice and calls for policy change.
33578778: Former Greek finance minister Yanis Varoufakis criticizes the bailout program, calling it a failure, as the German parliament approves negotiations for an €86bn bailout in exchange for austerity measures.
36888270: The International Paralympic Committee has opened proceedings against the National Paralympic Committee of Russia following a report on widespread doping, with a decision on any ban expected in early August.
36846007: London Irish sign 24-year-old Ben Ransom, who has Championship experience, but the length of his contract has not been disclosed.
31723471: Manor Marussia F1 team has secured investment from Ovo boss Stephen Fitzpatrick and appointed Justin King as interim chairman, aiming to be competitive in the upcoming season.
15921828: The Welsh government's budget deal with the Liberal Democrats includes a £38.9m stimulus package, but opposition parties criticize it as inadequate.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister Sir John Major criticizes the government's approach to Brexit, warning of substantial costs and a diminished diplomatic force.
20936833: The House of Commons is debating a bill to cap benefit rises at 1% for three years, with the coalition arguing it's necessary to reduce the deficit.
36832879: A hole in Forest Hill has caused major disruptions to train services, with engineers working to repair a collapsed sewer under the tracks.
14958201: Manchester City defeated Everton 2-0 with goals from Mario Balotelli and James Milner, showcasing their patience and persistence in the face of Everton's defensive tactics.
34352262: Nicola Sturgeon claimed to have met a target to reduce six-week delays in discharging patients, but Labour argued that the target had not been met for over three years.
39805395: The European Court of Justice ruled that the UK's overflow pipes at the Burry Inlet broke clean water laws, leading to a case involving other breaches around waste water handling.
34303109: Pope Francis visits Cuba, praising improved US-Cuba relations and urging support for Cuban Catholics, while avoiding direct criticism of the government's human rights record.
39939090: Rangi Chase joins Widnes after being dropped from Castleford, aiming to make a fresh start and contribute to the struggling team.
29347771: Cricket Scotland's chief executive, Roddy Smith, is stepping down after 10 years, leaving the organization in good health and with a growing game.
36783415: Sunderland wants Allardyce to stay as manager, but England is considering him for the national team's coach position.
37935687: Wales narrowly defeated Argentina in a hard-fought match, with Leigh Halfpenny's penalty proving to be the difference in a game that didn't meet expectations.
40260829: The Bulford Kiwi, carved by New Zealand troops, and the Terrain Model of Messines have been granted protection as scheduled monuments by the Department for Culture, Media and Sport.
36478199: Two inmates at HMP Wayland attempted to grab keys from officers, resulting in their transfer to a higher security jail and additional time added to their sentences.
34541803: Former Premier League player Chris Sutton believes that Aston Villa manager Tim Sherwood deserves more time to turn the team's performance around.
35360841: Transport Minister Edwina Hart plans to introduce measures to streamline the system and cut fraud after tough guidelines to tackle abuse were suspended by Neath Port Talbot council.
35550407: Life expectancy among older age groups in England rose to its highest level in 2014, but there is concern about elderly people living in poor health and variations across regions.
37561590: Operation Equinox is investigating hundreds of reported crimes of sexual, physical, and emotional abuse, with the majority occurring on council property and involving council staff.
39328843: The Women's FA Cup quarter-final draw has been announced, with Chelsea facing Sunderland, Manchester City playing Bristol City, and Liverpool hosting Notts County.
